forecast.name: Today
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy. High near 59, with temperatures falling to around 57 in the afternoon. South southeast wind 18 to 23 mph, with gusts as high as 39 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy, with a low around 55. South southeast wind around 20 mph, with gusts as high as 36 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between three quarters and one inch possible.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco, the day awakens under an enveloping blanket of clouds, heavy with the promise of rain. The air feels thick with moisture, a steadfast drizzle already gracing the streets, while the south-southeast wind cuts briskly at around 20 mph, stirring up the tides of a chill that seeps into your bones. The cityscape, shrouded in gray, wears a muted palette, echoing the somber call of the clouds mirrored in that endless bay, where the Golden Gate Bridge appears as a specter, cloaked and distant.

As midday approaches, expect the rain to intensify, with temperatures sliding gently downwards. Visibility is touched by the ghostly embrace of fog; the horizon blurs into the haziness of low clouds hugging the hills. This is a day for comfort—dress in layers, perhaps a warm, waterproof jacket and sturdy shoes to navigate the slick pavements. The languid patter of raindrops invites the solace found in a cozy café, the warmth of a steaming cup cradled in your hands while you watch the world outside blend into an impressionist painting of gray. Alternatively, explore the city's vibrant indoor spaces—art galleries or museums that breathe life into the cloudy chill, offering both refuge and inspiration.
